tagrelator.read
Class CorpusReader

java.lang.Object
  tagrelator.read.CorpusReader

public class CorpusReader
extends java.lang.Object

provides some methods load corpus data, and process them into a format for further computation by the PMI and SOC-PMI classes

Method Detail

readFromANCfiles

public RawCounts readFromANCfiles(java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> terms,
                                  java.lang.String pathToANC,
                                  java.lang.Integer aClength,
                                  java.lang.String aResultFile)
reads frequencies and context frequencies for the given terms from corpus files preprocessed by ANCprocessor in the folder specified.

Parameters:
terms - a set of terms for which context frequencies should be collected
pathToANC - to folder that holds corpus files that an ANCprocessor object computed
aClength - the number words which serve as context before and after a target word from terms is found
aResultFile - filename for the RawCounts object file that can be written to disk
if null nothing is written, if "" a default is used

readBNC

public RawCounts readBNC(java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> terms,
                         java.lang.String pathToBNC,
                         java.lang.Integer cLength,
                         java.lang.String resultFile)
                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
This method reads in the .tzip file containing BNC corpus Xml files, an d performs the counts of independent and dependent frequencies of the target words and their context words

Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

freqtester

private void freqtester(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> indepfreq,

readFromNgramFile

public RawCounts readFromNgramFile(java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> terms,
                                   java.lang.String nGramFilename,
                                   boolean saveResult)
reads in a plain text file with nGram frequencies expected: tab, comma, whitespace spearated. first Element has to be the frequency. computes quasi collocational counts for the terms

Parameters:
terms - contains the terms for which the counts should be computed
nGramFilename - a plain text file with nGram counts, if it is empty String it tries to use the DefNGramfile which is expected in working directory

readFromNgramFile

public RawCounts readFromNgramFile(java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> terms,
                                   java.lang.String nGramFilename,
                                   java.lang.String saveFile)

writeRawCounts

private boolean writeRawCounts(RawCounts someCounts,
                               java.lang.String fileName)
save a RawCounts Object that a read method contructed in specified file

Parameters:
someCounts - the counts that should be written to disk
fileName - filename where to save the object, if empty String default is used

readFromObj

public RawCounts readFromObj(java.lang.String fileName)
reads the counts from a previously computed RawCount object. this is much faster, than computing from the nGram files or ANC files. but of course the object only contains data for the terms that were given for run on which it was contructed.

readANCFile

private ANCdocument[] readANCFile(java.io.File file)
